instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO water damage, light on MagSafe, no fan, no booting.
threads.message:
Hi, 

No water damage on the board.

First value is board connected to power normally. Second value is board in SMC bypass mode:

L7130 - pulsating 12.14V-12.59V;     12.27V
L3095 - 0;    0
L7560 - pulsating 1.0V-3.0V;     3.34V
L7520 - pulsating 0.01V-0.07V;     0V
L7430 - 0V;      pulsating 0.51V-0.61V
L7320 - 0V;   0V
L7310 - 0V;  0V
L7630 - 0V;   0V

please advise how to proceed.Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO water damage, light on MagSafe, no fan, no booting.
threads.message:
In normal mode, 3V42 is stable?
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO water damage, light on MagSafe, no fan, no booting.
threads.message:
In normal mode, 3V42 is stable? - YES
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.12V and <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> -  pulsating 2-5V
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO water damage, light on MagSafe, no fan, no booting.
threads.message: Check for short at any of <CAPACITOR>C6412</CAPACITOR>/22/32/42.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO water damage, light on MagSafe, no fan, no booting.
threads.message: Short on all capacitors. Replaced one by one. <CAPACITOR>C6422</CAPACITOR> was the bastard. Problem solved. Motherboard fixed. Extremely happy. Thanks for you help. Do you mind me asking how did you arrive to that conclusion? I understand the problem was with <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> line because the voltage was pulsating but how did you know that there was a short on those capacitors?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO water damage, light on MagSafe, no fan, no booting.
threads.message: Is a common fail on this board...
